metadata.titleEn: Qilian Mountains integrated observatory network: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network (eddy covariance system of mixed forest station, 2020)
metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站涡动相关仪-2020）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the mixed forest station eddy covariance system (EC) in the downstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2020. The site (101.1335° E, 41.9903° N) was located in the Sidaoqiao County, in Ejina Banner in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region . The elevation is 874 m. The EC was installed at a height of 3.2 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3B & Li7500DS) was 0.17 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 10% of the 30 min raw record. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. The water vapor density data were rejected when the negative values occurred. Data during May 8 to 20, 2020 were missing due to instrument malfunction.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2020年1月1日至2020年12月31日的黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E, 41.9903N，海拔874 m。涡动相关仪的架高22m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3B）与CO2/H2O分析仪（Li7500DS）之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。冬季水汽密度出现一些负值，进行了剔除；5月8-20日由于仪器存储问题，数据缺失。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测，同时还观察了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统，闪烁仪，自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临的生态环境退化挑战有哪些？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: In oasis–desert ecosystems, a data collection method involves using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, along with hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period.
Example.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及从自动气象站获取10分钟平均周期的水文气象数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in conducting long-term observations of energy and carbon exchange in arid and semiarid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区进行长期能量和碳交换观测时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in conducting long-term observations in arid and semiarid areas is dealing with ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in inland river basins like the Tarim River basin.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区进行长期观察的一个挑战是应对生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在塔里木河流域等内陆河流流域。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that offers comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据集的示例，该数据集提供有关干旱地区能源、水蒸气和碳交换的全面数据？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset providing comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions includes observations from land surface flux and meteorological stations in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个提供干旱地区能量、水汽和碳交换综合数据的数据集，包括来自HRB中下游的陆面通量和气象站的观测数据，已在国家西藏高原数据中心免费提供。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the essential characteristics of data obtained from eddy covariance systems in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，从涡度协方差系统获得的数据的基本特征是什么？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the arid regions of western China since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在中国西部的干旱地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the term 'data quality evaluation' mean in the context of observational datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在观测数据集的背景下，“数据质量评估”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data quality evaluation refers to the process of assessing the accuracy and reliability of observational data. In the context of the mentioned datasets, it includes tests for atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics, as well as removing data affected by instrument errors or environmental conditions like precipitation. Quality is often categorized into levels, indicating the confidence in the data's accuracy.
Definition.AnswerCn: 数据质量评估是指评估观测数据的准确性和可靠性的过程。在提到的数据集的背景下，它包括对大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征的测试，以及去除受仪器错误或环境条件（如降水）影响的数据。数据质量通常被分为不同的级别，以指示对数据准确性的信心。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'oasis-desert interactions' in the context of ecosystem research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态系统研究的背景下，什么是“绿洲-沙漠相互作用”？
Definition.AnswerEn: Oasis-desert interactions refer to the ecological and climatic exchanges that occur between oasis regions and surrounding desert areas. These interactions are critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes, which are essential for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in arid regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠互动是指绿洲地区与周围沙漠区域之间发生的生态和气候交换。这些互动对于理解能量、水汽和碳的交换过程至关重要，这些过程对维持生态稳定和支持干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data collection challenges between inland river basins and oasis–desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域和绿洲-沙漠系统在数据收集方面的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face challenges like ecological degradation, drying water bodies, and dust storms which affect data collection, while oasis–desert systems deal with maintaining ecological stability and carbon balance, necessitating long-term monitoring of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange using specialized equipment like eddy covariance systems.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化、水体干涸和沙尘暴等挑战，这些问题影响了数据收集，而绿洲-沙漠系统则需要维持生态稳定和碳平衡，必须使用专门设备如涡度协方差系统进行能量、水汽和碳交换的长期监测。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can inconsistencies in hydrometeorological data collection methods affect the interpretation of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 水文气象数据收集方法中的不一致性如何影响对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Inconsistencies in hydrometeorological data collection, such as varying data collection intervals or equipment errors, can lead to inaccurate representation of fluxes and affect the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics. This can impact interpretations of oasis-desert interactions and ecological stability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据收集中的不一致性，例如数据收集间隔的变化或设备错误，可能导致通量的不准确表示，并影响对能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态的理解。这可能会影响对绿洲-沙漠相互作用和生态稳定性的解读。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the accuracy of long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid regions, and how could these affect the interpretation of ecological and climatic trends?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，确保长期观测数据集的准确性可能会面临哪些挑战，这些挑战又可能如何影响生态和气候趋势的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges such as equipment malfunctions, data loss during adverse weather conditions, and calibration issues can compromise dataset accuracy. These challenges can lead to misinterpretations of ecological and climatic trends, affecting assessments of carbon balance and sustainable development in oasis-desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 设备故障、恶劣天气条件下的数据丢失以及校准问题等挑战可能会影响数据集的准确性。这些挑战可能导致对生态和气候趋势的误解，从而影响对绿洲-沙漠系统中碳平衡和可持续发展的评估。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodologies could be employed to enhance the quality of data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, and what implications might improved data quality have on understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以采用哪些方法来提高能源、水蒸气和碳通量数据的质量？改善数据质量对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用可能产生什么影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Employing advanced quality control measures, such as rigorous data processing and error correction techniques, can enhance data quality. Improved data quality may lead to more accurate interpretations of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux patterns, thereby enriching understanding of oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological security efforts.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 采用先进的质量控制措施，如严格的数据处理和错误修正技术，可以提高数据质量。改善的数据质量可能导致对能量、水蒸气和碳通量模式的更准确解释，从而丰富对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，并支持生态安全工作。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What reasons underlie the need for rigorous data processing and quality control in the collection of turbulent flux data in oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集湍流通量数据时，严格的数据处理和质量控制的需求背后的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Rigorous data processing and quality control are necessary to ensure accuracy and reliability, especially given the challenges of environmental degradation such as drying rivers and land desertification in arid and semiarid inland river basins.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 严格的数据处理和质量控制对于确保准确性和可靠性是必要的，特别是在面对干旱河流和内陆河流流域的土地沙漠化等环境退化挑战时。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to collect long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测数据至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial to understand oasis–desert interactions and to maintain ecological stability and socioeconomic development, which are significant for achieving sustainable oasis development and supporting ecological security.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用以及维持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要，这对实现可持续的绿洲发展和支持生态安全具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors cause the need to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 造成在可持续绿洲发展中需要维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The balance is necessary to achieve sustainability as oases are vital for ecological environments and economic development in arid regions, particularly in western China, where they support a significant population despite comprising a small area of the region.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 平衡是实现可持续发展的必要条件，因为绿洲对生态环境和经济发展至关重要，尤其是在中国西部的干旱地区，尽管其面积较小，但却支持着大量人口。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using long-term observational datasets to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用长期观测数据集来理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using long-term observational datasets allows for a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. It supports the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality and bolsters ecological security and sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用长期观测数据集可以定量理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。它支持碳达峰和碳中和的目标，并增强生态安全和可持续发展。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What impact does the degradation of the ecological environment in inland river basins have on data collection and research in arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域生态环境的恶化对干旱和半干旱地区的数据收集和研究有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The degradation of the ecological environment in inland river basins, such as drying rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, and intensified land desertification, poses challenges to data collection and research. These adverse conditions can complicate the establishment and maintenance of observation stations and may affect the quality and continuity of the collected data, crucial for understanding and mitigating ecological degradation.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 内陆河流域生态环境的恶化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化以及土地沙漠化加剧，给数据收集和研究带来了挑战。这些不利条件可能会使观测站的建立和维护变得复杂，并可能影响所收集数据的质量和连续性，而这些数据对于理解和缓解生态退化至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the integration of auxiliary data, such as hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, enhance the understanding of oasis–desert systems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 辅助数据的整合，如水文气象、植被和土壤参数，如何增强对绿洲-沙漠系统的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters enhances the understanding of oasis–desert systems by providing a comprehensive dataset that captures the interactions between various environmental factors. This approach allows for more accurate modeling and analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, thus supporting more informed decision-making for sustainable development and ecological protection in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，可以增强对绿洲-沙漠系统的理解，因为它提供了一个全面的数据集，捕捉了各种环境因素之间的相互作用。这种方法允许对能量、水蒸气和碳通量进行更准确的建模和分析，从而支持在这些地区可持续发展和生态保护的更明智决策。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the ultimate goal of collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis-desert ecosystems using eddy covariance systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中使用涡度协方差系统收集长期能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的最终目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The ultimate goal is to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is critical for achieving sustainable oasis development, carbon peaking, and carbon neutrality, thus supporting ecological security and socioeconomic development in these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 最终目标是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、碳达峰和碳中和至关重要，从而支持这些地区的生态安全和社会经济发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of data collection on energy and carbon fluxes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在能源和碳通量的数据收集背景下，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is important to achieve sustainable oasis development and to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases, which play a crucial role in the carbon balance of arid regions and within the global carbon cycle.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展以及保护绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。绿洲在干旱地区的碳平衡和全球碳循环中发挥着重要作用。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals of using a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems, including energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to obtain a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial to recognize oasis–desert interactions and to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases, especially in the face of climate change and ecological degradation.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是获得对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展至关重要，特别是在气候变化和生态退化的背景下。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific steps involved in processing eddy covariance data to ensure quality and accuracy in measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区处理涡度相关数据以确保能量、水汽和碳通量测量的质量和准确性的具体步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The processing steps for eddy covariance data include removing outlier values, applying time delay corrections, performing coordinate rotation (double coordinate rotation), applying frequency response corrections, correcting ultrasonic virtual temperature, and applying density (WPL) corrections. Quality evaluation involves testing atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Additionally, data selection includes removing erroneous data due to instrument errors, eliminating data around precipitation events, and excluding data with high missing rates within the original 10Hz data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差数据的处理步骤包括去除异常值、应用时间延迟修正、进行坐标旋转（双坐标旋转）、应用频率响应修正、校正超声虚拟温度以及应用密度（WPL）修正。质量评估涉及测试大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。此外，数据选择包括去除由于仪器错误导致的错误数据、消除降水事件周围的数据以及排除原始10Hz数据中缺失率较高的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What protocols are followed to manage missing or erroneous data during the observation period, particularly in challenging environments such as the arid regions of western China?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在观察期间，特别是在中国西部的干旱地区，管理缺失或错误数据时遵循哪些协议？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Protocols for managing missing or erroneous data include marking missing data as -6999 and removing data with errors such as instrument malfunction, precipitation events, or high missing rates in the original data. Additionally, during periods like winter when water vapor density shows negative values, these are excluded to maintain data integrity. Data from specific problematic periods, such as storage issues, are also noted as missing.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 管理缺失或错误数据的协议包括将缺失数据标记为-6999，并删除因仪器故障、降水事件或原始数据缺失率过高而产生的错误数据。此外，在冬季等期间，当水蒸气密度显示负值时，这些数据也会被排除，以维护数据的完整性。特定问题时期的数据，例如存储问题，也会被标记为缺失。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the long-term collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期收集能量、水汽和碳通量数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as the eddy covariance system and scintillometer have enabled the long-term collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in oasis–desert ecosystems. These devices provide half-hourly turbulent flux data, which are essential for understanding ecological interactions in these areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪，使得在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能够长期收集能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据。这些设备提供半小时一次的湍流通量数据，对于理解这些地区的生态相互作用至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and methodologies are necessary to maintain high-quality data collection for understanding oasis and desert system interactions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 为了理解绿洲和沙漠系统的相互作用，维持高质量的数据收集需要哪些条件和方法？
Enablement.AnswerEn: High-quality data collection for understanding oasis and desert system interactions requires consistent observational datasets, rigorous data processing, and quality control procedures. It also necessitates conditions such as stable instrumentation, regular data archiving, and sharing practices, alongside well-established flux and meteorological stations throughout the study area.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高质量的数据收集以理解绿洲和沙漠系统之间的相互作用，需要一致的观测数据集、严格的数据处理和质量控制程序。它还需要稳定的仪器、定期的数据归档和共享实践，以及在研究区域内建立良好的通量和气象站。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might fluctuations in oasis–desert system interactions not be captured accurately by current data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统相互作用的波动可能无法通过当前的数据收集方法准确捕捉，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing ecological environment degradation, such as river drying, natural vegetation degradation, and intensified desertification, which could lead to challenges in capturing accurate interactions within oasis–desert systems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的问题，例如河流干涸、自然植被退化和沙漠化加剧，这可能导致在绿洲-沙漠系统中捕捉准确的相互作用面临挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the potential reasons for not achieving expected data quality in flux measurements within oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，未能达到预期数据质量的潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in flux measurements may arise from ecological environment degradation, frequent dust storms, and the need for long-term observations to ensure data quality and understand the interactions within oasis–desert ecosystems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在生态环境退化、频繁的沙尘暴以及需要长期观测以确保数据质量和理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统内相互作用的情况下，通量测量可能面临挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the anticipated outcomes of sustainable oasis development not be met despite data collection efforts?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管进行了数据收集工作，但可持续绿洲发展的预期结果可能仍未实现的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Despite data collection efforts, sustainable oasis development outcomes might not be met due to the ecological crises faced by inland river basins, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, and the impact of climate change on these environments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 尽管进行了数据收集努力，但由于内陆河流域面临的生态危机，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及气候变化对这些环境的影响，可持续绿洲发展成果可能无法实现。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the effectiveness of using eddy covariance systems for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid and semiarid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在干旱和半干旱地区使用涡度协方差系统捕捉能量、水蒸气和碳通量的有效性有何评估？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of eddy covariance systems is highly effective for capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid and semiarid regions, as they provide detailed and long-term observational data crucial for understanding the interactions within oasis-desert ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统在捕捉干旱和半干旱地区的能量、水蒸气和碳通量方面非常有效，因为它们提供了详细的长期观测数据，对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的相互作用至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you assess the challenges faced in maintaining data quality when collecting long-term observational datasets in the oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在收集沙漠-绿洲系统的长期观察数据集时，如何评估维护数据质量所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality include addressing issues such as instrument errors, data gaps due to storage problems, and environmental factors like dust storms and precipitation, which require rigorous data processing and quality control procedures to ensure reliable datasets.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量的挑战包括解决仪器错误、由于存储问题导致的数据缺口，以及像沙尘暴和降水等环境因素，这些都需要严格的数据处理和质量控制程序，以确保数据集的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the potential for expanding existing datasets to include additional parameters that might enhance the understanding of oasis-desert interactions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对扩展现有数据集以包括可能增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用理解的额外参数的潜力有何看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Expanding existing datasets to include additional parameters, such as more detailed soil and vegetation characteristics or advanced hydrometeorological measurements, could significantly enhance the understanding of oasis-desert interactions and support sustainable development strategies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展现有数据集以包括额外参数，例如更详细的土壤和植被特征或先进的水文气象测量，可能会显著增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，并支持可持续发展战略。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how the eddy covariance system measures energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白涡度协方差系统如何测量绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳通量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system measures these fluxes by collecting half-hourly turbulent flux data. This involves using high-frequency measurements of wind speed, temperature, and gas concentrations to calculate the vertical fluxes of energy, water vapor, and carbon dioxide.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统通过收集半小时的湍流通量数据来测量这些通量。这涉及使用高频率的风速、温度和气体浓度测量来计算能量、水蒸气和二氧化碳的垂直通量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about the challenges faced in maintaining data quality for long-term environmental observations in arid and semiarid regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱和半干旱地区维护长期环境观测数据质量所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality include dealing with ecological environment degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, and frequent dust storms. These factors can disrupt data collection and affect the reliability of the observations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量的挑战包括应对生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会干扰数据收集并影响观察的可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the data collection methods support the ecological security and sustainable development of oasis–desert areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据收集方法如何支持绿洲-沙漠地区的生态安全和可持续发展。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods provide a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. This understanding supports ecological stability and socioeconomic development by informing strategies for carbon peaking, carbon neutrality, and sustainable oasis development.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法提供了对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这种理解通过为碳达峰、碳中和和可持续绿洲发展提供信息，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the data collection techniques utilized for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems, focusing on the advantages and limitations of each method.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述用于测量绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集技术，重点介绍每种方法的优缺点。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In oasis–desert systems, data collection techniques for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange include the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for turbulent flux data, with auxiliary hydrometeorological data collected from automatic weather stations. Eddy covariance systems provide precise flux measurements but require complex correction procedures, while scintillometers offer broader spatial averaging. Automatic weather stations offer continuous environmental data but may require regular maintenance to ensure data accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集技术包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来获取湍流通量数据，同时从自动气象站收集辅助的水文气象数据。涡度协方差系统提供精确的通量测量，但需要复杂的修正程序，而闪烁仪则提供更广泛的空间平均。自动气象站提供连续的环境数据，但可能需要定期维护以确保数据的准确性。
